title: Family appeals for safe release of kidnapped 85-year-old grandfather | ABC NEWS
description: The family of an 85-year-old man, who detectives believe was mistakenly kidnapped in Sydney has appealed for his safe release. Police believe that up to three people, or possibly more, grabbed Chris Baghsarian from his bedroom and bundled him into a car, driving him to another location. title: US Secretary of State endorses far-right Hungarian PM Viktor Orban | ABC NEWS
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has endorsed far-right Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban ahead of the country’s national election. Rubio is pledging closer US-Hungary ties during his visit, signaling a step away from western European allies like France and Germany. title: Trump’s latest attack on climate science | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Donald Trump says it’s a scam to say that climate change is a threat to public health. So, the US president has killed off a scientific finding that says it is.   The so-called endangerment finding was the basis for nearly all climate laws in the US.   Now it’s gone, the White House hopes dirty industries can flourish again, including America’s petrol car manufacturers.    Today, ANU climate expert, Christian Downie on what happens when one of the world’s largest polluters gives up on reducing greenhouse gas emissions.    Featured:    Christian Downie, professor in the school of regulation and global governance at the Australian National University

description: Oscar-winning actor Robert Duvall, known for films such as The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95. Resident film critic Zak Hepburn discusses his legacy. title: Australian women and children with links to IS forced to return to Syrian camps | ABC NEWS
description: A group of Australian families linked to Islamic state fighters have been forced to return to a detention camp in Syria.  The ABC has been told there are 34 people in the group who were trying to journey home to Australia, but were stopped by Syrian authorities. The federal government says it will not repatriate people from Syria and those who have committed a crime will meet the full force of the law if they do return. title: Coles accused of misleading customers with 'Down Down' campaign | ABC NEWS
description: There has been intense debate about the pricing of more than 200 products at the opening of the landmark ACCC vs Coles court case. title: PM Albanese speaks on cost-of-living relief, housing affordability & ISIS brides | ABC NEWS

title: Former NRL player Matt Utai shot in drive-by shooting in Sydney’s southwest | ABC NEWS
description: Former NRL winger Matt Utai has been shot in a drive-by shooting in Sydney's southwest. The 44-year-old was taken to hospital in a serious condition after being treated on the scene by paramedics after sustaining multiple gunshot wounds. NSW Police have referred the shooting to the bikie gang-focused Raptor Squad. title: One dead, two critically injured in public area stabbing in Sydney's west | ABC NEWS
description: One person has been killed and two others critically injured in a stabbing attack near Merrylands train station in Sydney's west. Witnesses say a man stabbed multiple people before leaving the area on foot. Paramedics treated three people for serious injuries, but one person died at the scene. Two others were taken to hospital in a critical condition. Following inquiries, a man was arrested nearby and taken to Granville Police Station.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: One person has been killed and two others critically injured in a stabbing attack in Sydney's west.  Police were told on arrival at the scene in Merrylands on Tuesday morning that a man stabbed multiple people before leaving the area on foot.  Paramedics treated three people for serious injuries, but one person died at the scene.  Two others were taken to hospital in a critical condition.  Following inquiries, a man was arrested nearby and taken to Granville Police Station.  A crime scene has been established and an investigation is now underway. title: Protest restrictions on Sydney CBD, eastern suburbs lifted | ABC NEWS
description: Protest restrictions in Sydney's CBD and eastern suburbs have ended. NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon's decision to not extend the measures comes a week after clashes between officers and protesters during Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit. The controversial laws grant police the power to refuse authorisation for public protests for up to 90 days after a terrorist incident. title: Milano-Cortina: Can 'the GOAT' Mikaela Shiffrin overcome the yips?
description: American slalom skier Mikaela Shiffrin is one of the sport's best, but when it comes to performing at the Olympic Games in recent times she's succumbed to the pressure. With one event to go in her program, can she overcome her nerves? Plus a missed opportunity for Australia to increase its record medal tally and we speak to a very proud father.    Featured: Matt Futterman, senior sports writer, The Athletic. Erin Marsicovetere, ABC SPORT. Michael Fordham, father of Olympian Rosie Fordham.   Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Albanese government will not help ISIS-linked families return home from Syria | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the federal government will not bring back Australian families who have ties to Islamic State (IS) fighters. The ABC was told that a group of 34 Australians, including 11 women and 23 children, had to be turned back after Syrian authorities said their trip from the Kurdish-controlled area was not properly arranged with officials. Liberal Senator and Shadow Home Affairs Minister Jonathon Duniam says the government isn't doing enough to actively prevent the cohort from returning. title: Police say Merrylands stabbings appear to have been random attack | ABC NEWS
description: One man has been killed and two people were critically injured in a stabbing attack in Merrylands CBD in Sydney's west.  A man was arrested nearby and taken to Granville Police Station. NSW Police Superintendent Simon Glasser says it appears to have been a random attack and the alleged offender is known to police for petty crime and a number of mental health incidents.
